examples: Certain species of fucoid algae serve as habitats for small marine creatures.
Whales are incredible marine animals that migrate long distances.
Certain species of dinoflagellates can create red tides, affecting marine life.
Brown algae create habitats and provide food for marine species.
The sea is home to a variety of marine life, such as fish, dolphins, and coral reefs.
words.defineEn: related to the sea and the different life forms that exist there
words.defineVi: liên quan đến biển và các dạng sống khác nhau tồn tại ở đó

examples: And the emperor’s successors weren’t very interested in maritime trade.
In the 12th century, the wealthy maritime republic of Pisa set about turning its cathedral square into a magnificent landmark.
But the idea of a maritime version of President Trump's Mexican wall has been condemned.
And so you got domains in play there, a little bit of maritime and land.
James Delgado is a historian and maritime archaeologist who has researched the history of this inlet on Alabama's southern coast.
words.defineEn: relating to or involving ships or shipping or navigation or seamen
words.defineVi: liên quan đến hoặc liên quan đến tàu hoặc vận chuyển hoặc điều hướng hoặc thủy thủ
cố ý cố chấp; bướng bỉnh không vâng lời

words.defineEn: willful refusal to appear before a court or comply with a court order; can result in a finding of contempt of court

words.defineEn: a rude expression intended to offend or hurt
words.defineVi: một biểu hiện thô lỗ nhằm xúc phạm hoặc làm tổn thương

examples: The green skin reminds me of the Neolithic jade figures with taotie-like decorative design.
Teams of scientists have found evidence of milk consumption in Neolithic populations in Britain, dating back roughly six thousand years.
In fact, many scholars argue that the taotie design originated far earlier, in Neolithic times, citing images of the taotie beast-face across multiple artistic forms, including jade objects.
These Neolithic farmers stored their excess grain in large pits and short, clay silos.
Around five thousand years ago, Neolithic villagers constructed the first known toilets at Skara Brae.
words.defineEn: of or relating to the most recent period of the Stone Age (following the mesolithic)
words.defineVi: thuộc hoặc liên quan đến giai đoạn gần đây nhất của thời kỳ đồ đá (sau thời kỳ đồ đá giữa)

words.defineVi: hành động phát minh ra một từ hoặc cụm từ

words.defineEn: a recently born organism, especially a newborn baby or an animal
words.defineVi: một sinh vật được sinh ra gần đây, đặc biệt là một đứa trẻ sơ sinh hoặc một con vật

examples: I'm a total neophyte.
words.defineEn: any new participant in some activity
words.defineVi: bất kỳ người tham gia mới nào trong một số hoạt động

examples: The seasoned politician scoffed at the young upstart's superficial promises, muttering that you cannot catch old birds with chaff, as he knew from experience that voters were not easily swayed by empty rhetoric.
The debate between the two politicians was intense, as diamond cuts diamond, and both were skilled in rhetoric and argumentation.
AMNA NAWAZ: You mentioned the rhetoric.
A new American president used rhetoric that would resonate with Netanyahu's view of the world.
The gunman had been posting anti-Semitic rhetoric on Gab for years before the shooting.
words.defineEn: the study of the rules and different methods of using language in a way that is effective
words.defineVi: nghiên cứu các quy tắc và các phương pháp khác nhau để sử dụng ngôn ngữ theo cách hiệu quả

examples: A famous rhetorician in the 5th and 4th century BCE, Isocrates, was even buried in a tomb emblazoned with a Siren as a symbol of his masterful use of language and exceptional skills in speaking.
words.defineEn: a person who delivers a speech or oration
words.defineVi: một người đưa ra một bài phát biểu hoặc bài phát biểu

examples: And when they meet, they annihilate!

LEILA MOLANA-ALLEN: Centuries of history annihilated in a few short months.
And if matter and antimatter come together, then they annihilate, which is the very simplified version of what antimatter is.
Which means that everything in the universe should have annihilated itself.

And it attempts to find new pretext to attack President Trump I think that it testifies to a certain element of a crisis in the US political system per say just have a look at what is happening the groups that are mounting an offensive against the legitimately elected president are simply disagreeing with the choice of the American people annulling the vote results that's exactly what a political crisis is this is something unseen before in the US history

examples: My grandfather used to say, he that touches pitch shall be defiled, so keep yourself away from trouble.
Touching the body would defile his spirit, draining his life force and leaving him forsaken by the kami.
I don't like to defile it with ketchup.
This taboo of defilement hung over the sick and deceased, as well as those who defiled the land or committed violent crimes.
words.defineVi: đốm, vết bẩn hoặc ô nhiễm

examples: A federal judge just sent the CEO up the river for 45 years for defrauding millions of customers.

Just years after its executives perpetrated what might be one of the worst examples of corporate malfeasance in automotive history, the American people, the EPA and their counterparts around the world have been defrauded by Volkswagen.
The company was charged with defrauding safety regulators after two fatal crashes that killed 346 people.
Did he have the intent to defraud the people of Georgia of their right to have a fair election?
I have repeatedly used deceit to cheat, con, or defraud others for my personal gain.
words.defineEn: to cheat someone by using deception or dishonesty, usually for financial gain
